title: Problem 2116_B
statement: Flower gives Gellyfish two permutations^{\text{∗}} of [0, 1, ..., n-1]: p_0, p_1, ..., p_{n-1} and q_0, q_1, ..., q_{n-1}.Now Gellyfish wants to calculate an array r_0,r_1,...,r_{n-1} through the following method: For all i (0 ≤q i ≤q n-1), r_i = \max\limits_{j=0}^{i} ≤ft(2^{p_j} + 2^{q_{i-j}} \right) But since Gellyfish is very lazy, you have to help her figure out the elements of r.Since the elements of r are very large, you are only required to output the elements of r modulo 998\,244\,353.^{
